Title: The impact of the P-pillar structure design on Breakdown Voltage for 1.2kV 4H-SiC Superjunction DMOSFET
Authors: Y. -C. Lee; K. -H. Lin; K. -Y. Lee
Source title: 2021 IEEE International Future Energy Electronics Conference (IFEEC)
Abstract: 1.2kV-class 4H-SiC super junction (SJ) DMOSFET was designed and optimized in this work. Several P-pillar structures and dosage variation were used to target the charge balance condition in order to optimize breakdown voltage (BV) with low specific on-resistance $(R_{on, sp})$. Vertical electric field distribution of SJ DMOSFET performs a relatively uniform distribution compared with planer DMOSFET. Horizontal electric field distribution shows a peak value at the junction of N and P pillar, while the electric field distribution decline rate affects the final BV value effectively. In this study, we demonstrated the impact of adjusting the P-pillar width and scaling down the device on BV through a series of electric field analysis.
Author Keywords: 4H-SiC power MOSFET;super junction;DMOSFET;breakdown voltage;charge balance;electric field distribution
Authors with affiliations: Deptment of Engineering Science and Ocean Engineering, Nationl Taiwan University, Taipei, Country; Deptment of Engineering Science and Ocean Engineering, Nationl Taiwan University, Taipei, Country; Deptment of Engineering Science and Ocean Engineering, Nationl Taiwan University, Taipei, Country

Title: Revenue management model of Passenger Dedicated Line Based on passenger buy up behavior
Authors: J. Zhao
Source title: 2022 International Conference on Artificial Intelligence of Things and Crowdsensing (AIoTCs)
Abstract: In order to meet the growing demand for intercity passenger transport, China is further extending and expanding the coverage of the rapid passenger transport network while building the “four vertical and four horizontal” passenger dedicated line. The construction and operation of passenger dedicated lines have greatly alleviated the bottleneck of railway passenger transport capacity, and inevitably intensified the competition among various transportation modes in the domestic passenger transport market, resulting in the further embodiment of the market-oriented operation trend of passenger dedicated lines. Therefore, the research on revenue management of passenger dedicated lines, especially the research on revenue management based on passenger choice behavior rather than just from the perspective of passenger dedicated line companies, not only reflects the idea of taking passengers as the center, but also belongs to the hot spot of revenue management research, which has important theoretical and practical significance, and provides a reference and new perspective for the implementation of revenue management of passenger dedicated lines.
Author Keywords: Passenger buy up behavior;Railway passenger dedicated line;Revenue management model
Authors with affiliations: Shandong Institute of Commerce and Technology, Zibo, Shandong, China

Title: Fingers Crossed: An Analysis of Cross-Device Finger Vein Recognition
Authors: T. Arican; R. Veldhuis; L. Spreeuwers
Source title: 2022 International Conference of the Biometrics Special Interest Group (BIOSIG)
Abstract: Finger veins are one of the emerging biometric traits attracting many researchers in biometric recognition. Despite the growing literature on finger vein recognition, little interest has been shown in the impact of acquisition devices on recognition performance due to the lack of a multi-sensor finger vein database. This work aims to fill this gap by creating such a database using five different acquisition devices. We then analyze their impact on finger vein recognition performance. The analysis shows two main challenges that decrease recognition performance, namely scaling between device sensors and horizontal shifts between image pairs. The findings of this research give insight into developing more robust finger vein recognition algorithms.
Author Keywords: Finger vein recognition;cross-sensor comparison;vein pattern comparison
Authors with affiliations: EEMCS - DMB, University of Twente, Enschede, Netherlands; EEMCS - DMB, University of Twente, Enschede, Netherlands; EEMCS - DMB, University of Twente, Enschede, Netherlands

Title: CongestNN: An Bi-Directional Congestion Prediction Framework for Large-Scale Heterogeneous FPGAs
Authors: C. Ma; Y. Xiao; S. Wang; J. Yu; J. Chen
Source title: 2021 IEEE 14th International Conference on ASIC (ASICON)
Abstract: As FPGA technology continues scaling, design closure process requires more iterations during placement and routing (P&R) for large designs. Accurate advanced routing congestion prediction can effectively relieve this problem on a large scale, which is considered as one of the most significant and toughest tasks in the FPGA design flow. This paper proposes a novel deep-learning framework named CongestNN to predict routing congestion maps of both horizontal and vertical directions in the global placement (GP) stage with a unique combination of GP-based features. A-net, a newly designed type of Fully Convolutional Network (FCN), is deployed to accomplish the prediction part given the input features. The model is trained and tested on GPU using 22,682 cropped feature maps derived from 112 industrial benchmarks placed by the Procise placer and corresponding golden congestion images supplied by Xilinx Vivado. CongestNN is also incorporated into Procise straightforward to provide instant congestion predictions with the average PCC of 95.18%, while the runtime merely takes over one second.
Author Keywords: Routability;Congestion map;FPGA;Global placement;FCN
Authors with affiliations: State Key Laboratory of ASIC and System, Fudan University, Shanghai, China; State Key Laboratory of ASIC and System, Fudan University, Shanghai, China; Shanghai Fudan Microelectronics Group Co., Ltd, Shanghai, China; State Key Laboratory of ASIC and System, Fudan University, Shanghai, China; State Key Laboratory of ASIC and System, Fudan University, Shanghai, China

Title: A Method for Yaw Error Alignment of Wind Turbine Based on LiDAR
Authors: L. Zhang; Q. Yang
Source title: IEEE Access
Abstract: Yaw control is an important part of the control system of a horizontal shaft wind turbine. After the installation of the wind turbine, the turbulence influence of the wind turbine blades and the azimuth of the wind turbine will cause yaw error which directly affects the economic and the safety of the wind turbine. This article introduces a method for aligning the yaw error of a wind turbine mounted with a LiDAR anemometer, in which the power and the yaw azimuth of the wind turbine, recorded by a SCADA system, are divided into 22 power segments and 12 yaw azimuth sectors respectively. Combining the yaw error angles measured by the LiDAR, a 3D table of yaw error angles is prepared based on the power segments and yaw azimuth sectors of the wind turbine. Using the table of the yaw error angles, the wind turbine yaw error is aligned for capturing the maximum wind energy. According to the analysis of the data measured on-site, the proposed method is found effective in improving the AEP of the aligned wind turbine. Furthermore, taking the alignment of yaw error in a 48.6MW wind farm as an example, the economy and feasibility of the proposed method are analyzed.
Author Keywords: LiDAR;wind turbine;yaw error alignment
Authors with affiliations: Jiangsu Key Construction Laboratory of IoT Application Technology, Wuxi Taihu University, Wuxi, China; Jiangsu Key Construction Laboratory of IoT Application Technology, Wuxi Taihu University, Wuxi, China

Title: Research on Multi-level Container Security Mechanism Based on Lightweight Virtualization Environment
Authors: L. Chen; Y. Ma; Z. Shao; M. Chen
Source title: 2020 13th International Conference on Intelligent Computation Technology and Automation (ICICTA)
Abstract: As an increasingly popular virtualization technology in recent years, Docker technology has attracted more and more attention due to its light weight, low resource consumption, and rapid deployment. However, due to the limitations of Docker's own mechanism, the container lacks the boundaries owned by traditional virtual machines, and there are security risks such as horizontal expansion of permissions and data leakage during operation. This paper has designed a multi-level based on lightweight virtualization environment The container security mechanism applies multi-level security access control technology to the security protection of the container, thereby effectively controlling the flow of information in the container, Establish a container-based security access control boundary.
Author Keywords: Lightweight Virtualization;Docker;Multilevel;Security Machanism
Authors with affiliations: Institute of Information and Communication, Global Energy Interconnection Research Institute, Nanjing Jiangsu, China; Institute of Information and Communication, Global Energy Interconnection Research Institute, Nanjing Jiangsu, China; Institute of Information and Communication, Global Energy Interconnection Research Institute, Nanjing Jiangsu, China; Institute of Information and Communication, Global Energy Interconnection Research Institute, Nanjing Jiangsu, China

Title: Potential Possibilities of Highly Accurate Satellite Navigation Use for Landing Operations of Unmanned Aerial Systems
Authors: S. Ilnytska; V. Kondratiuk; O. Kutsenko; V. Konin
Source title: 2019 IEEE 5th International Conference Actual Problems of Unmanned Aerial Vehicles Developments (APUAVD)
Abstract: The results of MultiGNSS experimental research in precise positioning mode with TerraStar corrections are presented. The potential possibilities to ensure (provide) safe landing operation of Unmanned Aerial Systems of all categories, including CAT III meteorological minimum, are demonstrated. The errors of vertical coordinate determination are proposed to be estimated in two vertical planes (East Up and North Up correspondently). Experimental data approve accuracy of coordinates determination to be 10 cm (99%) for horizontal plane and 18 cm (99%) for vertical planes.
Author Keywords: Landing Operations;multi GNSS;accuracy;Precise Point Positioning (PPP);TerraStar;Unmanned Aerial Systems;experimental research
Authors with affiliations: National Aviation University, Kyiv, Ukraine; Research and Training Center, “Aerospace Center”, National Aviation University, Kyiv, Ukraine; Research and Training Center, “Aerospace Center”, National Aviation University, Kyiv, Ukraine; Aeronavigation systems department, National Aviation University, Kyiv, Ukraine

Title: Multi-View Imaging System Using Paraboloidal Mirror Arrays for Efficient Acquisition of Dynamic Light Fields
Authors: S. Fujigaki; K. Kodama; T. Hamamoto
Source title: 2019 IEEE International Conference on Image Processing (ICIP)
Abstract: Lens arrays enable us to easily achieve inexpensive light field acquisition in comparison with massive camera arrays. However, their micro-lenses often cause insufficient exposure to obtain high quality multi-view videos like camera arrays. In this paper, we propose a novel virtual camera array acquiring dynamic light fields as multi-view videos robustly and inexpensively, where mirror arrays consisting of tangent planes to a paraboloid are effectively combined with a single video camera. First, we demonstrate multi-view imaging of not an object but ordinary scenes with sufficient exposure by using a simple horizontal mirror array implemented as a prototype. Next, we theoretically reveal that there exists smooth extension of our mirror array to the vertical direction, that can be implemented easily by 3D printing, CNC machines, and so on. Finally, our design of light field acquisition is improved for effectively utilizing the whole of its mirror array by introducing an one-way mirror to prevent the camera itself from appearing on multi-view images.
Author Keywords: light field;multi-view;acquisition;mirror;paraboloid
Authors with affiliations: Graduate School of Engineering, Tokyo University of Science, Tokyo, Japan; National Institute of Informatics, Research Organization of Information and Systems, Tokyo, Japan; Graduate School of Engineering, Tokyo University of Science, Tokyo, Japan

Title: OBU Design and Test Analysis with Centimeter-Level Positioning for LTE-V2X
Authors: H. Kong; W. Chen; S. Fu; H. Zheng; L. Du; Y. Mao
Source title: 2019 5th International Conference on Transportation Information and Safety (ICTIS)
Abstract: As an important part of the Internet of vehicles (IoV) system, many research team have been working on the development of On-Board Unit (OBU) with high precision. In this paper, a new centimeter-level positioning OBU based on LTE-V, dead reckoning (DR) and network real time kinematic (RTK) positioning is designed. The hardware and software design of the terminal are introduced in detail. And the performance indexes, including delay, packet loss rate, static and dynamic positioning accuracy of the terminal, are measured in two scenarios. The experimental results show that the dynamic horizontal positioning error is less than 35mm, which is relatively high precision in IoV system.
Author Keywords: high-precision positioning;OBU;RTK;dead reckoning;LTE-V2X
Authors with affiliations: School of Automation, Wuhan University of Technology, Wuhan, China; School of Automation, Wuhan University of Technology, Wuhan, China; School of Automation, Wuhan University of Technology, Wuhan, China; Research Center for ICVT, Reseach and Development Shanghai Engineering Technology, Shanghai, China; School of Automation, Wuhan University of Technology, Wuhan, China; School of Automation, Wuhan University of Technology, Wuhan, China

Title: Multi-task Data Augmentation Method Joint Object Detection and Semantic Segmentation
Authors: P. Huang; Y. Zhu
Source title: 2022 International Conference on Machine Learning and Knowledge Engineering (MLKE)
Abstract: Data augmentation is a commonly used method for training networks in deep learning. For object detection tasks, data augmentation methods include random flip, random crop, etc. For semantic segmentation tasks, data enhancement includes horizontal flip, random saturation transformation, etc. With the application of deep learning technology in autonomous driving, many multi-task networks based on deep learning have proposed. These multi-task networks can simultaneously process target detection tasks and semantic segmentation tasks in autonomous driving. For the multi-task data augmentation, the existing methods can only take some simple methods. This paper proposed an effective data augmentation method, which can combine the data augmentation of object detection and semantic segmentation at the same time.
Author Keywords: Deep Learning;Data Augmentation;Autonomous Driving;Multitask
Authors with affiliations: Guangxi Normal University; School of Computer Science & Information Engineering, Shanghai Institute of Technology

Title: Design and Analysis of a Grid-Tied Dual Rotor PMSG and SCIG-Based Wind Farms
Authors: M. T. Nafisa; E. Jahan; M. A. Mannan
Source title: 2021 IEEE 9th Region 10 Humanitarian Technology Conference (R10-HTC)
Abstract: Since the last decade, the number of grid-connected wind farms (WFs) has increased. Conventionally, a horizontal axis wind turbine (HAWT) with single rotor is widely used in WF applications, and the blade root region (adjacent to the hub) of a HAWT suffers from aerodynamic incompetence due to various non-aerodynamic limitations. WF performance is also significantly reduced due to aerodynamic interactions between turbines. To address this problem, a dual rotor wind turbine (DRWT) for permanent magnet synchronous generator (PMSG) and squirrel cage induction generator (SCIG) is built in this paper to improve the WF's performance. The DRWT is made up of two types of rotors: main and secondary. In comparison to HAWT, the proposed DRWT mechanism will extract more mechanical resources. When the wind speed is poor, the overall architecture will function properly. The PSCAD/EMTDC software is used to build and evaluate a hybrid power system that includes a robust DRWT-PMSG, DRWT- SCIG model, and a traditional power plant. According to simulation results, the built DRWT can extract more power than a traditional single rotor HAWT.
Author Keywords: Hybrid power system;DRWT;PMSG;SCIG
Authors with affiliations: Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering, American International University- Bangladesh (AIUB), Dhaka, Bangladesh; Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering, American International University- Bangladesh (AIUB), Dhaka, Bangladesh; Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering, American International University- Bangladesh (AIUB), Dhaka, Bangladesh

Title: Image Processing Based Human Pursuing Robot
Authors: M. Sharikmaslat; R. Sidhaye; A. Narkar
Source title: 2019 3rd International conference on Electronics, Communication and Aerospace Technology (ICECA)
Abstract: This paper is about a robot which is made to follow a human being through computer vision. The system looks for a barcode in the video frame and when found, it is bounded into a rectangle and the center coordinates of the rectangle are found out. These coordinates are compared with the center of the image and on the basis of the horizontal position of barcode the commands are given to the robot, to move left, right or forward. This Robot for image processing uses OpenCV library and programming with python. The processor board used for the robot is Raspberry pi for image processing and Arduino is used to driving motors. An ultrasonic sensor is used to calculate the distance between the robot and the human being.
Author Keywords: Robot;Computer Vision;Barcode;Image processing;OpenCV;python;Raspberry pi;Arduino;Ultrasonic sensor
Authors with affiliations: Department of Electronics Engineering, Dr. J.J. Magdum College of Engineering, Jaysingpur, Maharashtra, India; Department of Electronics Engineering, Dr. J.J. Magdum College of Engineering, Jaysingpur, Maharashtra, India; Department of Electronics Engineering, Dr. J.J. Magdum College of Engineering, Jaysingpur, Maharashtra, India

Title: Evaluation of Psychological Load of Air Defense Members by Physiological Data Monitoring Compared to the Questionnaire Evaluation Method
Authors: P. Kutilek; J. Hejda; P. Volf; V. Krivanek; L. Cicmanec; K. Hana; P. Smrcka; I. Fajnerova
Source title: 2020 19th International Conference on Mechatronics - Mechatronika (ME)
Abstract: This paper aims to evaluate psychological load assessment methods in air defense members. The study is based on physiological data monitoring and compares this method with traditional questionnaire evaluation methods. Measurement using a biotelemetric system was conducted while training in flight simulators. A total of 28 subjects/soldiers were divided into seven four-member teams consisting of two pilots, an air traffic controller and a member of ground support. Physiological data was collected and monitored for all subjects during a mission flight operation. Calculations of the R-R interval length and respiratory rate were performed for all soldiers involved. Statistical analysis, i.e. the calculation of the median, maximum, minimum, first quartile and third quartile were used for physiological data presentation and the quantitative evaluation of mental stress. These results were then compared with results showing the subjective degree of psychological stress load, as determined by the questionnaire evaluation method. A simple rating scales repeatedly evaluated by individual subjects were used to determine their subjective level of mental stress before and after individual phases of the training. The data for takeoff, landing, horizontal flight and fall were evaluated and compared. Then the results for both evaluation approaches (physiological data measurement and questionnaire-based subjective evaluation) were compared. Since the normal data distribution was not shown, statistical evaluation was conducted through non-parametric tests. Based on the calculated values of the physiological parameters compared with the determined value of the questionnaire method's rating scale, it was found that with increasing mental load determined by the subjective evaluation method, the length of the R-R interval decreased and the respiratory rate increased. These conclusions were consistent for different flight phases and within the groups of pilots, air traffic controllers and ground support members.
Author Keywords: Physiological Data;Stress Load;Air Force;Rating Scale;Questionnaire Evaluation
Authors with affiliations: Faculty of Biomedical Engineering, Czech Technical University in Prague, Kladno, Czech Republic; Faculty of Biomedical Engineering, Czech Technical University in Prague, Kladno, Czech Republic; Faculty of Biomedical Engineering, Czech Technical University in Prague, Kladno, Czech Republic; Faculty of Military Technology, University of Defense, Brno, Czech Republic; Faculty of Military Technology, University of Defense, Brno, Czech Republic; Faculty of Biomedical Engineering, Czech Technical University in Prague, Kladno, Czech Republic; Faculty of Biomedical Engineering, Czech Technical University in Prague, Kladno, Czech Republic; National Institute of Mental Health, Klecany, Czech Republic

Title: Automatic Spine Bone Segmentation and Feature Extraction in Computed Tomography Images for Biometric Recognition
Authors: W. Obaid; M. S. Obaidat
Source title: 2020 International Conference on Computer, Information and Telecommunication Systems (CITS)
Abstract: Biometric features that are obtained from the hard tissues of the human body may be the only available choice for many people identification cases. Bones and teeth are examples of human body hard tissues. This paper proposes a technique that is useful for the purpose of person identification by relying on the extracted features which are obtained from spine bone that is segmented on computed tomography (CT) images of the abdomen. The technique performs automatic spine bone segmentation using a combination of k-means clustering, iterative elimination of false regions using Euclidean distance with respect to a central pattern, k-means clustering using smaller number of clusters, and iterative image subtraction combined with iterative Gaussian filtering. The technique obtains vertical and horizontal histogram features from the extracted spine bones. The last step is performing histogram Euclidean distance comparisons for the purpose of recognition and identification of the results.
Author Keywords: Person Identification;Biometrics;Spine Bone Segmentation;Image Recognition;Computed Tomography
Authors with affiliations: College of Computing and Informatics, Univeristy of Sharajah, Sharajah, UAE; College of Computing and Informatics, Univeristy of Sharajah, Sharajah, UAE

Title: Study of the Integration of Robot in Cyber-Physical Production Systems
Authors: Q. Liu; P. Hua; A. Sultan; L. Shen; E. Mueller; F. Boerner
Source title: 2019 International Conference on Cyber-Enabled Distributed Computing and Knowledge Discovery (CyberC)
Abstract: Robots are expected to be used in the smart manufacturing and smart factory with the help of information and communication technologies. The increasing and consistent integration of ICTs and robot into the production systems in subsystems and components are needed. The mechatronic systems become cyber-physical systems through additional communication skills and autonomy in behavior on external influences and internally stored settings. Robots are integrated in the Cyber-Physical Production System to realize smart factory and smart manufacturing. In a laboratory environment, innovative logistical systems integrated with robots are built up to apply horizontal and vertical integration into practice for research investigations.
Author Keywords: robot, Cyber-Physical Production System, integration
Authors with affiliations: School of Mechanical Engineering, University of South China, Hengyang, China; School of Mechanical Engineering, University of South China, Hengyang, China; School of Mechanical Engineering, University of South China, Hengyang, China; School of Mechanical Engineering, University of South China, Hengyang, China; Department of Factory Planning and Factory Management, Chemnitz University of Technology, Chemnitz, Germany; Department of Factory Planning and Factory Management, Chemnitz University of Technology, Chemnitz, Germany

Title: Heading Calibration in Robot Soccer ERSOW using Line Landmark on The Field
Authors: F. Lui Hakim Ihsan; R. Adryantoro Priambudi; M. Mobed Bachtiar; I. Kumianto Wibowo
Source title: 2020 International Electronics Symposium (IES)
Abstract: This paper will present the heading calibration which is used on the Ersow's robot using line sensors. The robot must have the capabilities of avoiding obstacles, kicks the ball, and localization. All of those abilities are dependent on the robot heading data in the form of an angular degree unit. The drawback of the heading data is getting worse when the sensor is activated in a long period. This happens because IMU sensor is drifting along the time that causes a shifting orientation perception. This condition will create an enormous error in the robot system. The proposed way to solve this problem is calibrating the IMU data each necessary. The robot is placed in the field by looking for unique features. In this case, is the horizontal lines. We are using a microcontroller-based line sensor with an independent embedded microcontroller. The purposes of using the line sensors are the fast computation and the cheapest hardware to be built. The line sensor is expected to produce deviation data that is eligible to send towards Artificial Intelligent processed. Based on the result of the experiment average error by drifting robot heading -1.67 degree in every minute. The average error value with robot speed at 10 cm/s is 2.1 degree, at 50 cm/s is 1 degree, at 100 cm/s is 0.7 degree, and at 150 cm/s is 1.2 degree. The accuracy of this calibration method obtained as 99.65%. This improvement will make the robot increasing the accuracy of position estimation in the field.
Author Keywords: line sensor;localization;robot heading;sensor calibration;soccer robots
Authors with affiliations: Department of Informatics and Computer Engineering, Politeknik Elektronika Negeri Surabaya, Surabaya, Indonesia; Department of Informatics and Computer Engineering, Politeknik Elektronika Negeri Surabaya, Surabaya, Indonesia; Department of Informatics and Computer Engineering, Politeknik Elektronika Negeri Surabaya, Surabaya, Indonesia; Department of Informatics and Computer Engineering, Politeknik Elektronika Negeri Surabaya, Surabaya, Indonesia

Title: Implementation of Ultra High Definition Video Output with Zynq-7000 for CNC Machines and Industrial Equipment
Authors: M. Popov; K. Orlova; A. Romanov
Source title: 2023 International Conference on Industrial Engineering, Applications and Manufacturing (ICIEAM)
Abstract: The article presents a method of video output subsystem’s development with an ultra-high resolution (2560 x 1440 pixels and higher) support, a method for assessing the permissible video mode parameters and setting drivers, as well as an example of successful implementation of such a subsystem based on entry-level chips of the Zynq-7000 family. The features of a hardware platform definition in the Vivado environment and the Petalinux operational system configuration and setup are described. The results of the subsystem’s test runs using various video modes are presented, including horizontal and vertical resolution value as well as a frame refresh rate.
Author Keywords: Zynq;high resolution;UHD;FPGA;video output;Petalinux;user interface
Authors with affiliations: Department of Research and Development, Bigprinter Digital Innovations, LLC, Moscow, Russia; Department of Research and Development, Bigprinter Digital Innovations, LLC, Moscow, Russia; HSE University, Moscow, Russia

Title: Aerial Manipulation using a Human-Embodied Drone Interface
Authors: D. Kim; P. Y. Oh
Source title: 2022 IEEE International Conference on Advanced Robotics and Its Social Impacts (ARSO)
Abstract: This paper presents a human-embodied drone interface for aerial manipulation. With the immersive frame-work constructed by Unity and Virtual and Augment Reality (VR/AR), the system allows the operator to leverage their intelligence to evaluate the tasks and collaboratively perform the desired tasks beyond the operator’s line-of-sight with a mobile manipulating drone. Flight trials demonstrate the results from three horizontal tasks including drilling, peg-in-hole, and key manipulation to illustrate the efficacy of this system. This paper concludes that the successful human-embodied drone interface can contribute to society by the following: a quality dataset for autonomous dexterous aerial manipulation; hardware-free training system; opportunities for various people who live outside of normal life boundaries.
Authors with affiliations: Mechanical Engineering Department, University of Nevada, Las Vegas (UNLV); Mechanical Engineering Department, University of Nevada, Las Vegas (UNLV)

Title: Posture Stabilization of Quadruped Walking Robot, PongBot with Disturbances
Authors: N. -S. Kwak; J. -Y. Kim
Source title: 2020 17th International Conference on Ubiquitous Robots (UR)
Abstract: This paper describes the posture stabilization of the quadruped walking robot, PongBot, in the presence of the disturbances. The proposed posture stabilization is mainly composed of the two sub-controllers: body balance controller and body moving controller. The body balance controller is working at all times in the background, and the activation of the body moving controller is determined according to magnitude of disturbances. First, the body balance controller, which is mainly effective for small disturbances, maintains the level body through the optimal distribution of the vertical ground reaction forces on the feet. The body moving controller, which is primarily for large disturbances, performs the posture stabilization through the horizontal body movement, and it is activated together with the body balance controller. Finally, the performance of the proposed method was experimentally verified by using the quadruped walking robot, PongBot, in the presence of the changing ground slope and external impacts.
Authors with affiliations: Dept. of Mechanical Design and Robot Eng., Seoul Nat’l Univ. of Science and Technology, Seoul, Korea; Dept. of Mechanical Design and Robot Eng., Seoul Nat’l Univ. of Science and Technology, Seoul, Korea

Title: Solar Irradiance Prediction using Deep Learning-Based Approaches
Authors: N. G. Hari; J. G
Source title: 2022 IEEE Asia-Pacific Conference on Computer Science and Data Engineering (CSDE)
Abstract: The worst effects of pollution from greenhouse gas emissions are increase in atmospheric temperature, sea level rise, and a variety of diseases. The main source of greenhouse gases is the combustion of fossil fuels, especially in thermal power plants. The use of renewable energy sources, such as solar energy, can significantly reduce this pollution. The amount of electricity produced from solar energy can be maximised by placing the solar power plant in an area with high direct horizontal irradiance (DHI). Solar irradiance predictions will help to design and build solar power facilities very efficiently. However, accurate prediction is a challenge. In this study, the deep learning approaches such as single-layered LSTM and stacked LSTM variations like two-layered LSTM and three-layered LSTM are used to forecast DHI.
Author Keywords: Solar irradiation;forecasting;deep learning;LSTM;stacked LSTM
Authors with affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Rajagiri School of Engineering and Technology, Kochi, India; Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Rajagiri School of Engineering and Technology, Kochi, India

Title: Autonomous Underwater Glider Navigation with Single Seabed Beacon
Authors: F. Liu; H. Chen; L. Xie
Source title: Global Oceans 2020: Singapore – U.S. Gulf Coast
Abstract: In this paper, we focus on the problem of the positioning and navigation of underwater gliders (UGs), and propose an underwater mobile vehicle positioning and navigation method based on Extended Kalman Filter (EKF) with single seabed beacon. In our proposed method, a clock balanced factor is introduced to mitigate the clock asynchronization between the beacon and the underwater mobile vehicle, which means that the strict clock synchronization between the seabed beacon and the UG is not required. Moreover, since no velocity logs are equipped on the UG, we infer the horizontal velocity using the attitude information and the depth information. The proposed positioning and navigation method results is validated by simulations and a sea trial, which exhibits a good performance.
Author Keywords: Single beacon;underwater glider (UG);Extended Kalman Filter (EKF);positioning and navigation
Authors with affiliations: College of Information Science and Electronic Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; Zhoushan Ocean Research Center, Zhoushan, China; Zhejiang Provincial Key Laboratory of Information Processing, Communication and Networking, Hangzhou, China

Title: A Local Area Segmentation Algorithm for the Underwater Transponder Calibration
Authors: H. Zhang; X. Xu
Source title: 2022 7th International Conference on Robotics and Automation Engineering (ICRAE)
Abstract: The accuracy in depth estimation of the transponder calibration algorithms based on Long Baseline (LBL) technology needs to be improved, especially in the case of no Depth Gauge (DG), poor depth estimation will directly affect the spatial positioning accuracy. In order to comprehensively improve the solution accuracy of transponder calibration, this paper proposes a calibration algorithm based on Local Area Segmentation (LAS) method. According to the simulation results, LAS performs the best in depth estimation, horizontal positioning solution and spatial positioning accuracy.
Author Keywords: transponder calibration;TOA;optimization algorithm;underwater positioning;LBL
Authors with affiliations: Key Laboratory of Micro-Inertial Instrument and Advanced Navigation Technology, Ministry of Education, School of Instrument Science and Engineering Southeast, University, Nanjing, China; Key Laboratory of Micro-Inertial Instrument and Advanced Navigation Technology, Ministry of Education, School of Instrument Science and Engineering Southeast, University, Nanjing, China

Title: Modeling PV-Wind-Battery Hybrid System for Guest House in Matakus Island
Authors: A. L. Padmadewi; B. Halimi; L. P. Sihite
Source title: 2023 4th International Conference on High Voltage Engineering and Power Systems (ICHVEPS)
Abstract: Renewable energy sources, such as solar and wind energy, present a practical option for fulfilling the electricity generation needs, particularly in areas without electricity access, like Matakus Island. This island has significant potential for utilizing renewable energy, particularly solar and wind energy, due to its coastal location. With an average Global Horizontal Irradiation (GHI) of 6.03 kWh/m2/day and an average wind speed of 6.3 m/s, Matakus Island is well-suited for utilizing these resources. To assess the stability of the proposed Hybrid Power Plant system, modeling is conducted using MATLAB/Simulink. These software tools allow for the evaluation and simulation of the system’s performance under various conditions, ensuring its stability and reliability. The economic analysis of the hybrid power plant is carried out using HOMER Pro, which aids in determining the overall cost-effectiveness of the system. It optimizes the configuration by considering components such as PV panels, wind turbines, batteries, and diesel generators, to find the most economically efficient setup for the hybrid power plant. The electrical system, consisting of an 18.7 kW PV system, a 3kW wind turbine, and a 54 kWh battery, has a Cost of Energy (COE) of Rp. 7,467/kWh, achieves a 100% Renewable Fraction (RF), and results in total annual savings of Rp. 38.1 million. In contrast, relying solely on pure diesel generators leads to a higher COE of Rp. 10,990/kWh, a 0% RF, and generates CO2 emissions of 16, 75Skg/year. The COE using the PV-Wind-battery hybrid system is 32% cheaper than using a diesel generator, demonstrating the significant cost advantage of the hybrid system. By implementing a hybrid power plant that combines solar and wind energy with battery storage, Matakus Island can achieve stable and cost-effective electricity generation. This transition to renewable energy not only reduces reliance on expensive and polluting diesel generators but also contributes to a cleaner and more sustainable energy supply.
Author Keywords: PV;Wind Turbine;Hybrid Power Plant;Renewable;MATLAB/Simulink;HOMER Pro
Authors with affiliations: Electrical Power Engineering, School of Electrical Engineering and Informatics, Bandung Institute of Technology, Bandung, Indonesia; Electrical Power Engineering, School of Electrical Engineering and Informatics, Bandung Institute of Technology, Bandung, Indonesia; Electrical Power Engineering, School of Electrical Engineering and Informatics, Bandung Institute of Technology, Bandung, Indonesia

Title: The intelligent detection and separation of geometric errors of four-axis CNC machine tool turntable
Authors: Z. Ma; B. Tang
Source title: 2022 International Conference on Manufacturing, Industrial Automation and Electronics (ICMIAE)
Abstract: When the CNC machine tool turntable rotates, geometric errors in the direction of 6 degrees of freedom were produced. Traditional measurement methods mainly measure the error of a degree of freedom alone, which have problems of low detection efficiency, troublesome operation and inconvenient field test. This paper presented a method for fast separation of six geometric errors of turntable, which was based on THM46100 high-precision four-axis horizontal machining center. To confirm the validity of the proposed method, the filed test was conducted. This paper first introduced the identification model of six-degree-of-freedom errors of the CNC machine tool turntable. Then, with the help of the ball-bar device, the geometric error detection and separation experiment of the turntable were carried out, and the three displacement errors and three angle errors are identified. As a result, the proposed method had the advantages of simple operation, high detection efficiency and suitable for field test.
Author Keywords: turntable;geometric errors;ball-bar device;identification model
Authors with affiliations: Guizhou Communications Polytechnic, Guiyang, China; Shenzhen Yinchuangli Technology Co., Limited, Shenzhen, China

Title: Modeling of the Exoskeleton Foot and Supporting Surface Interaction
Authors: S. F. Jatsun; A. V. Fedorov; E. V. Saveleva; A. E. Karlov; A. I. Soglaev
Source title: 2020 13th International Conference on Developments in eSystems Engineering (DeSE)
Abstract: The increased interest in anthropomorphic devices is due to the wide possibilities for traveling over rough terrain, stairs, overcoming obstacles, as well as the ability to carry out both horizontal and vertical jumps. The article discusses one of the most important nodes of such robots - the foot, which ensures the interaction of the robot with the supporting surface. The article analyzes the existing approaches to modeling the walking robots' foot and develops the active multi-link foot structure, which has advantages when walking on an uneven surface. A method for calculating electric drives is proposed and the main structural elements of the device are designed. The foot three-dimensional model was developed and the strength of individual structural parts was checked. The foot links movement mathematical model in the sagittal plane is given. The equations of motion are obtained, the results of computational experiments are presented.
Author Keywords: exoskeleton;active foot;electric drives;mathematical modeling;rough terrain walking;foot links motion;inverse kinematic problem
