Title: An Approach to Apply Reinforcement Learning for a VNF Scaling Problem
Authors: H. T. Nguyen; T. V. Do; A. Hegyi; C. Rotter
Source title: 2019 22nd Conference on Innovation in Clouds, Internet and Networks and Workshops (ICIN)
Abstract: The concept of Network Functions Virtualisation provides the rapid and flexible deployment of new services for telco operators. Horizontal scaling is applied when one or more instances of a virtual network function component or a virtual network function are added or removed in response to the traffic from the users. In this paper, we present how Reinforcement Learning can help scaling the virtual network function components. Our results show that Reinforcement Learning can be used to control the scaling decisions in the Management and Orchestration of Network Function Virtualisation.
Authors with affiliations: Balatonfüred Student Research Group, Budapest University of Technology and Economics; Department of Networked Systems and Services, Budapest University of Technology and Economics; Nokia Bell Labs, Budapest, Hungary; Nokia Bell Labs, Budapest, Hungary

Title: Dependability of V2I Services in the Communication Network of the Intelligent Transport Systems
Authors: I. Kabashkin
Source title: 2019 6th International Conference on Models and Technologies for Intelligent Transportation Systems (MT-ITS)
Abstract: Intelligent Transport System (ITS) applications are focused on improving road safety and creating new transport services. To realize the potential of ITS applications, data exchange should be efficiently carried out through direct communication over short distances both between vehicles (V2V) and between vehicles and infrastructure (V2I). High demands are placed on ITS performance indicators. These requirements are increasing especially in the context of the new mobility patterns using autonomous vehicles. The ITS big data processing can be centralized or distributed. The centralized approach utilizes the power of cloud computing. In contrast to cloud computing, intelligent data processing with faster responses and higher quality can be provided by fog computing. Fog computing is a horizontal, system-level architecture that distributes computing, storage, control and networking functions closer to the users along a cloud-to-thing continuum. Implementing fog computing in the dynamic environment of ITS to provide real-time big data analytics is facing many challenges that are not covered by previous research studies. The article analyzes the availability of V2I services in distributed communication network of ITS with fog-based architecture from reliability point of view. The dependability of V2I services for end users of smart vehicle in fog operating ITS is defined. The mathematical model of the reliability of a separate dedicated service in fog-based ITS for end user applications in the real conditions of operation is developed.
Author Keywords: reliability;availability;intelligent transport systems;fog architecture;V2I communications
Authors with affiliations: Transport and Telecommunication Institute, Riga, Latvia

Title: Accuracy Assessment of UAV photogrammetry for Large Scale Topographic Mapping
Authors: R. Q. Ismael; Q. Z. Henari
Source title: 2019 International Engineering Conference (IEC)
Abstract: Now a day's Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) replaces the aeroplane flown by a pilot, and a small high-resolution digital camera replaces the large metric camera, the combination of both are used as a platform for acquiring aerial images, so as called UAV photogrammetry. This study concentrates on the use and the capabilities of UAV photogrammetry for producing topographic maps, and to assess the accuracy of these maps. For that, a lightweight fixed-wing UAV eBee - Sensefly was used as a platform for acquiring aerial digital images of the study area. Before the flight mission, ground control points were established, Leica GS15 GPS determined their 3D coordinates in two sessions of static observations. The digital images were processed using Pix4Dmapper software for producing orthophotos and digital surface models. For accuracy assessment, the root mean square errors (RMSE) is used in which 2.0 cm in Easting, 2.1 cm in Northing and 7.5 cm in Elevation were obtained for orthomosaic and DTM respectively. Based on these assessments, the results showed that the accuracy achieved is following (ASPRS Accuracy Standards for Digital Geospatial Data) within the second and third classes of these standards for horizontal and vertical accuracies. In conclusion, this study shows that UAV photogrammetry can be applied for producing digital maps, orthophotos, contour lines, digital terrain model, digital surface model, and line maps all of them complies with international standards.
Author Keywords: UAV;Photogrammetry;Orthomosaic;DTM;GSD
Authors with affiliations: Geomatics Engineering Department, Salahaddin University-Erbil, Erbil, Iraq; Surveying and Geomatics Engineering Department, Tishik International University, Erbil, Iraq

Title: Ridged Waveguide Slot Phased Array for 5G Millimeter-wave Application
Authors: J. Zhou; H. Wang; J. Cao; G. Liang; S. Jiang
Source title: 2019 Cross Strait Quad-Regional Radio Science and Wireless Technology Conference (CSQRWC)
Abstract: A slotted waveguide phased array based on a single-ridged waveguide (SRWG) with enhanced scanning angle, wide impedance bandwidth and side lobes bandwidth, as well as low cross-polarization is designed. A transition structure is designed to feed the ridge waveguide with polarization torsion and conversion from the ridge waveguide to a standard rectangular waveguide. A single waveguide is divided into two subarrays to achieve small angle scanning in vertical dimension (yoz plane). An 8 × 8 array is designed and simulated to validate the slot antenna design. The bandwidth for VSWR<;2.0 is 3 GHz at the center frequency of 28 GHz. The realized gain at the center frequency is 24.0 dBi with antenna efficiencies better than 83%. The side lobes are controlled lower than -15dB over the entire working frequency, and the array can achieve a horizontal (xoz plane) scanning angle of ±45°, and vertical scanning angle of ± 3°, respectively.
Author Keywords: phased array;ridge waveguide slot antenna;low sidelobe
Authors with affiliations: School of Electronic and Optical Engineering, Nanjing University of Science and Technology, Nanjing, CHINA; School of Electronic and Optical Engineering, Nanjing University of Science and Technology, Nanjing, CHINA; School of Electronic and Optical Engineering, Nanjing University of Science and Technology, Nanjing, CHINA; Jiangsu Pivotone Communication Technology Co., Ltd., Wuxi, CHINA; Jiangsu Pivotone Communication Technology Co., Ltd., Wuxi, CHINA

Title: W-Band GB-SAR for 3D Imaging
Authors: A. Beni; T. Consumi; L. Miccinesi; M. Pieraccini
Source title: 2022 19th European Radar Conference (EuRAD)
Abstract: This paper presents a W-band Ground-based Synthetic Aperture Radar system able to acquire high resolution 3D images in just about 10 minutes. Resolution in both the horizontal plane and in elevation are obtained through mechanical scanning of the radar head along two orthogonal directions. In this paper, authors illustrate the system design and performances. The results of some experimental tests performed both in controlled and in urban scenario are shown.
Author Keywords: ground-based synthetic aperture radar;synthetic aperture radar
Authors with affiliations: Department of Information Engineering, University of Florence, Italy; Department of Information Engineering, University of Florence, Italy; Department of Information Engineering, University of Florence, Italy; Department of Information Engineering, University of Florence, Italy

Title: Analytical Treatment to Find Stability of the System of Partial Equations Arising from Heat Transfer on A porous Plate
Authors: A. M. Jumaa
Source title: 2021 7th International Conference on Contemporary Information Technology and Mathematics (ICCITM)
Abstract: This paper presents the analytical solution for a mathematical model of heat transfer by free convection which arises from the flowing of fluid on a porous plate. The plate is laid on a horizontal position with temperature source at the surface of the plate that is different from the surrounding atmosphere temperature. The governing mathematical equations, which have been established, consist of partial differential equations with some boundary conditions. The model has been converted into a boundary value problem, and in this case, an analytical solution was adopted by using a perturbation of the functions which are playing the important role in the solution of the system like temperature, velocity. These functions help to find the necessary factor that controls the stability of the problem. The outcome results showed that the wave number has the significant effect in the stability.
Author Keywords: mathematical modeling;porous plate;free convective;stability factor
Authors with affiliations: Department of Mathematics, College of computer sciences and mathematics, University of Mosul, Mosul, Iraq

Title: A Dual-Polarized Traveling-Wave Slot Array for X-Band Applications
Authors: S. Deng; Q. -M. Cai; M. Liu; X. Cao; T. Liu; Y. Zhu; F. Guo; J. Fan
Source title: 2022 Asia-Pacific International Symposium on Electromagnetic Compatibility (APEMC)
Abstract: In this paper, based on a single-ridged waveguide (SRWG) and a rectangular waveguide (RWG), a 16 ×56 slotted waveguide antenna array with dual-polarization, high gain and low side-lobe level is designed and simulated at X-band to validate the slot antenna design for the traveling wave. In this array, the longitudinal slot etched on the broad sidewall of the SRWG is employed for vertical polarization (VP) radiation, while the inclined slot cut in the narrow wall of the RWG is employed for horizontal polarization (HP) radiation. From the simulated results, the bandwidth of the designed antenna for voltage standing wave ratio (VSWR) < 1.5 is 0.8GHz at the center frequency of 9.4 GHz. The realized gain at 9.4 GHz is 31dBi with antenna efficiencies better than 83%. The side-lobe level is controlled lower than -31dB over the entire bandwidth. The beam width is 1.6 degrees and the beam direction is 4.5 degrees at 9.4 GHz. The realized gain, beam width, beam pointing and side-lobe of the two polarization modes are almost the same at 9.0GHz, 9.4 GHz and 9.8 GHz. Due to its high gain, compact size, low side-lobe level and easy manufacturing, this array can be combined with the edge-slotted waveguide array to build a two-dimensional dual-polarization antenna array for the applications of sea based X-band radar, satellite communication station, etc.
Author Keywords: Dual-Polarization;waveguide slot;antenna array;low side-lobe;high gain
Authors with affiliations: School of Information Engineering, Southwest University of Science and Technology, Mianyang, China; School of Information Engineering, Southwest University of Science and Technology, Mianyang, China; Innovation Center of Zhongshan Torch Modern Industrial Engineering Technology Research Institute, Guangdong, China; School of Information Engineering, Southwest University of Science and Technology, Mianyang, China; Sichuan Jiuzhou Electric Group Co., Ltd, Mianyang, China; School of Information Engineering, Southwest University of Science and Technology, Mianyang, China; School of Information Engineering, Southwest University of Science and Technology, Mianyang, China; School of Information Engineering, Southwest University of Science and Technology, Mianyang, China

Title: Study on Stray Current and Potential Distribution of Mtero under Complex Geological Conditions
Authors: H. Zhang; S. Lin
Source title: 2020 IEEE Sustainable Power and Energy Conference (iSPEC)
Abstract: As the adverse effects of stray current intensify, it is a pressing need to better control and undermine effection of the metro stray current. In this paper, the electromagnetic finite element method is elaborated to establish the model of metro traction power supply system and the underground soil structure including the uniform soil, horizontal layered soil, vertical layered soil and arbitrary non-uniform block soil. Analyze conductor by using discretization with one-dimensional finite element, and the soil block is discretized by three-dimensional finite element. Next, set and solve the stiffness matrix with the boundary conditions, and solve the scalar potential, current density, and stray current of all nodes in the soil block through the established equation. Finally, the distribution characteristics of the electric potential and stray current of metro under complex geological conditions are presented.
Author Keywords: complex geological conditions;finite element method;potential;stray current
Authors with affiliations: School of Electricl Engineering, Southwest Jiaotong University, Chengdu, China; School of Electricl Engineering, Southwest Jiaotong University, Chengdu, China

Title: Linear-to-Circular Polarization Converter Based on Meander-line Metasurfaces
Authors: Y. Zhao; J. Fu; W. Chen; B. Lv; Z. Wang
Source title: 2021 IEEE International Magnetic Conference (INTERMAG)
Abstract: In this paper, a novel linear-to-circular polarization converter based on meander-line metasurfaces is presented. The proposed metasurfaces is a two-dimensional periodic structure which consists of two metallic layers separated by dielectric substrate. The structure of each unit is meander-line which is printed on the top and bottom metallic layers. By controlling different phase for vertical and horizontal electric field components of incident wave, the phase difference is 90° between two components, after passing through the metasurfaces. The metasurfaces converts the linear polarization wave to circular polarization wave with the bandwidth of 10.5~11.5 GHz. The simulation results show the metasurfaces is valuable for polarization conversion application.
Author Keywords: metasurfaces;polarization conversion;circular polarization;meander-line
Authors with affiliations: School of Electronics and Information Engineering, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, CO, China; School of Electronics and Information Engineering, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, CO, China; Space Basic Science Research Center, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, CO, China; Science College, Harbin Engineering University, Harbin, CO, China; School of Electronics and Information Engineering, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, CO, China

Title: Analyses of Power Staple Inserting Methodologies for Mitigating IR-Drops
Authors: J. Yoon; S. Chung; T. Kim
Source title: 2021 18th International SoC Design Conference (ISOCC)
Abstract: As the process technology scales down and the supply voltage is getting low, meeting the IR-drop constraint becomes much more difficult. Inserting power staples, i.e., connecting adjacent power rails (called vertical staples) or stacking metal segments on a power rail (called horizontal staples) is a well-known technique for IR-drop mitigation. However, so far no analyses have been performed regarding the following two issues: (1) which type of staple insertion outperforms the other? (2) how much the staple insertion applied at the pre-placement and the post-routing (relatively) impacts on the IR-drop mitigation. In addition, based on the analyses, we propose a power staple insertion flow that is able to effectively minimize the maximal IR-drop while controlling the number of routing failures.
Author Keywords: Power delivery network;IR-drop;power staple insertion
Authors with affiliations: Dept. of Electrical and Computer Eng., Seoul National University, Seoul, South Korea; Dept. of Electrical and Computer Eng., Seoul National University, Seoul, South Korea; Dept. of Electrical and Computer Eng., Seoul National University, Seoul, South Korea

Title: Dual-Band Dual-Polarized Slot Antenna Arrays with Wide Bandwidth
Authors: J. Huang; X. Gong
Source title: 2020 IEEE International Symposium on Antennas and Propagation and North American Radio Science Meeting
Abstract: A novel slot antenna array, which are able to operate at both $\boldsymbol{S}$ and $\boldsymbol{C}$ bands with dual polarizations in each band and wide bandwidth, is presented in this paper. This shared antenna aperture can operate as a $\mathbf{2}\times \mathbf{2}\ \boldsymbol{S}$ -band array covering 2.65 to 4.05 GHz and a $\mathbf{4}\times \mathbf{4}\ \boldsymbol{C}$ -band array covering 4.65 to 7.57 GHz at the same time. The antenna arrays at both bands exhibit dual polarizations by using a diagonal feeding method. By properly controlling the relative phase of each port, either vertical or horizontal polarization can be realized. The isolation between the ports for different bands is better than 15 dB in most of the frequency range.
Author Keywords: Antenna array;slot antenna;wideband antenna
Authors with affiliations: Department of Electrical & Computer Engineering, University of Central Florida, Orlando, Florida; Department of Electrical & Computer Engineering, University of Central Florida, Orlando, Florida

Title: Tunable Terahertz Metamaterial with Single-/Dual-Band Switching Characteristic
Authors: X. Hu; D. Yao; H. Ou; D. Zheng; L. Wu; Y. -S. Lin
Source title: 2019 International Conference on Optical MEMS and Nanophotonics (OMN)
Abstract: We present a design of tunable terahertz (THz) metamaterial filter with single-band and dual-band switching characteristics. The proposed device is composed of dual splitring resonator (SRR) and a central bar. To control the horizontal and vertical displacement between the central bar and SRR, the resonance could be tuned by 0.08 THz and the transmission intensity is keeping as 100%. The electromagnetic response of proposed device exhibits polarization-dependence and single-/dual-band switching characteristics. These results open an avenue to be potentially used for detector, sensor, and switch applications in THz spectra range.
Author Keywords: tunable;metamaterial;filter;terahertz;MEMS
Authors with affiliations: State Key Laboratory of Optoelectronic Materials and Technologies, School of Electronics and Information Technology, Sun Yat-Sen University, Guangzhou, China; State Key Laboratory of Optoelectronic Materials and Technologies, School of Electronics and Information Technology, Sun Yat-Sen University, Guangzhou, China; State Key Laboratory of Optoelectronic Materials and Technologies, School of Electronics and Information Technology, Sun Yat-Sen University, Guangzhou, China; State Key Laboratory of Optoelectronic Materials and Technologies, School of Electronics and Information Technology, Sun Yat-Sen University, Guangzhou, China; State Key Laboratory of Optoelectronic Materials and Technologies, School of Electronics and Information Technology, Sun Yat-Sen University, Guangzhou, China; State Key Laboratory of Optoelectronic Materials and Technologies, School of Electronics and Information Technology, Sun Yat-Sen University, Guangzhou, China

Title: A Comparison of Vertically Integrated Combline Filter Approaches in PCB
Authors: T. Stander
Source title: 2021 International Conference on Electrical, Computer and Energy Technologies (ICECET)
Abstract: Vertical stacking of planar line resonators in multilayer media produces filters with a smaller footprint than horizontal coplanar positioning of the same resonators, especially for high order filters. Strong broadside line coupling, however, makes it difficult to synthesize filters of moderate or narrow bandwidth. In this paper, a new method of positioning vertically stacked planar combline resonators is proposed, whereby the resonators are rotated around the common short-circuit termination rather than horizontally displaced to control coupling. The coupling is found to be mixed-mode, but predominantly inductive. This method is shown to produce filters of moderate bandwidth. Four variations of a 5th order filter are demonstrated, achieving 1.92 - 3.3 dB IL over 10% FBW around 10 GHz while occupying between 6.62 - 22.47 mm2 surface area on a 7 layer PCB.
Author Keywords: Combline filter;microwave filter;multilayer technology;printed circuits
Authors with affiliations: Dept. EEC Engineering, Carl and Emily Fuchs Institute for Microelectronics, University of Pretoria, Pretoria, South Africa

Title: Design of a Dual-Input Doherty Power Amplifier With Selectable Output Port
Authors: Y. Yao; W. Shi; J. Pang; Z. Dai; M. Li
Source title: IEEE Transactions on Circuits and Systems II: Express Briefs
Abstract: Power amplifiers (PAs) equipped with selectable or switchable output ports can often improve the performances of the microwave systems, especially in radar and satellite communication systems where both horizontal and vertical polarization can be utilized. To enable a selectable output port, this brief develops a dual-input dual-output (DIDO) Doherty power amplifier (DPA), which has a simple circuit topology. The DIDO-DPA is consists of two identical sub-amplifiers and a 90° coupler. The input amplitudes of the two sub-amplifiers and their phase difference is dynamically controlled leveraging on the dual-input technique, leading to a flexible power transferring and enhanced back-off efficiency. As a validation, a DIDO-DPA operating at 2.4 GHz is fabricated and measured in this brief. The fabricated DIDO-DPA delivers an output power of more than 43.3 dBm, a maximum drain efficiency (DE) of more than 69.5%, and a 6-dB back-off DE of more than 58% at each output port.
Author Keywords: Dual-output;Doherty power amplifier;power transferring
Authors with affiliations: School of Intelligent Technology and Engineering, Chongqing University of Science and Technology, Chongqing, China; School of Microelectronics and Communication Engineering, Chongqing University, Chongqing, China; School of Microelectronics and Communication Engineering, Chongqing University, Chongqing, China; School of Microelectronics and Communication Engineering, Chongqing University, Chongqing, China; School of Microelectronics and Communication Engineering, Chongqing University, Chongqing, China

Title: Pattern-Reconfigurable Antenna Using Low-Profile Electric and Magnetic Radiators
Authors: S. Zhao; Z. Wang; Y. Dong
Source title: IEEE Antennas and Wireless Propagation Letters
Abstract: A compact antenna based on low-profile radiator pairs with high pattern reconfiguration diversity is proposed in this letter. The antenna consists of four hybrid radiator pairs and a reconfigurable feeding network. By switching the on/off states of four positive-intrinsic-negative (PIN) diodes, which are integrated into the reconfigurable network, the activation states of the four radiator pairs can be separately controlled. Each pair employs one low-profile electric radiator (monopole) and one low-profile magnetic radiator for stable directional radiation and structural compactness. As a result, the radiation beam can be electrically and directionally scanned in the horizontal plane (ϕ-plane). Eight different radiation modes can be obtained within an overlapped bandwidth. A prototype is designed, fabricated, and tested. Good impedance matching and stable directional radiation patterns are achieved over the entire operating band from 3.4 to 3.70 GHz in the measurement. The fabricated antenna features a compact size of 0.46 λg × 0.46 λg × 0.13 λg (λg represents the guided wavelength at 3.5 GHz). The proposed antenna is well-suitable for space-limited Sub-6 GHz smart and intelligent applications.
Author Keywords: Electric resonator;low-profile;magnetic resonator;pattern-reconfigurable antenna;stable pattern
Authors with affiliations: School of Electronic Engineering, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Chengdu, China; School of Electronic Engineering, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Chengdu, China; School of Electronic Engineering, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Chengdu, China

Title: High Thermal Assembly Solution for Large FOEB Chiplets Integrated Package in HPC Application
Authors: H. -J. Lin; X. -Z. Hsu; L. -Y. Wang; Y. H. Hsu; Y. P. Wang
Source title: 2022 23rd International Conference on Electronic Packaging Technology (ICEPT)
Abstract: High performance computing (HPC) and networking products have become more functions and need the larger die size, high density transistor and large memory capacity for computing procedure. To reach high calculation speed for networking product, it will need advanced SoC die like 7nm/5nm to reach networking requirement. Currently, design IC house and Semiconductor industry face the limit of Moore’s Law including the challenge of low wafer yield but high wafer cost for advanced SoC wafer preparion. To get higher wafer yield with low cost saving, design IC house prefer to use chiplet to separate function to muti-chips. In order to connect different functional chips and improve the electrical transmission between chips, the heterogeneous/ homogeneous integration package types as chiplet integrated idea come out and become popular, these package can used TSI ( through silicon via interposer), Fan-out Redistribution Layer (FORDL) or Embedded bridge die (EB) as die connection. 2.5D package with a through silicon via interposer is the most popular and already production in market. Based on published HPC products on the market, the package trend are integrated more HBM or die, larger package size with dissipation capacity. The 2.5D disadvantage are high TSI cost and low yield of TSI wafer and complex MEOL (middle end of line) process flow. IC design houses are looking for alterative package of 2.5D to support large chip module package.In this paper, structure is used FORDL (Fan-out Redistribution Layer) structure with small embedded bridge die as signal horizontal connection between die, and TMV (through mold via) structure for vertical connection, this structure is no need complex MEOL process. By using molding interposer to replace silicon interposer will help to control chip module warpage because smaller CTE mismatch with substrate. But there is a thermal concern for FOEB structure, because molding thermal capability is worse than silicon wafer. In this paper, we demonstrate two solution to enhance FOEB package thermal capability to reach end product request. One solution is build thick TMV to replace fine TSV (through silicon via) structure. By selecting suitable Dry film and optimized Litho process, there is no photoresist residue or TMV crack in cross-section. It has thicker RDL and larger diameter TMV are benefit to power ground preference and transmission of electrical signals. The other solution is using BSM (backside metal) and Metal TIM treatment to enhance FOEB package level thermal capability. Metal TIM has better thermal conductive than X23, but poor TIM coverage on interface and die crack risk during HS clamping process. In our test vehicle result, TIM coverage meet criteria at T0 and after reliability test, there is no EMC or UF crack issue and lid delam issue in SAT.FOEB structure with thick TMV and BSM / Metal TIM is success pass reliability test including MSL4, TCJ 3000 cycle and uHAST 264hrs. This chiplet integration solution allows high I/O density, fine L/S, and good heat dissipation capacity for heterogeneous/ homogeneous integration package.
Author Keywords: Silicon Bridges;Backside metal;Chiplet Integration
Authors with affiliations: Advanced Process and Technology Development Department, SPIL, Taiwan, China; Package Application Engineering Division, SPIL, Taiwan, China; Package Application Engineering Division, SPIL, Taiwan, China; Advanced Process and Technology Development Department, SPIL, Taiwan, China; Package Application Engineering Division, SPIL, Taiwan, China

Title: Research on the Influence Mechanism of Artificial Intelligence on Lateral Channel Spillover Effect
Authors: X. Li; J. Chen
Source title: 2021 International Conference on Internet, Education and Information Technology (IEIT)
Abstract: With big data and artificial intelligence, we conduct the research of the buyers' identification and involvement, and their investments such as time, experience and consultation in various channels are analyzed and iterated. We establish a set of AI channel governance system with the functions of members' behavior monitoring, transaction clearing and deterrence; Through the system, the horizontal spillover effect of their behavior is controlled. Thus, their unfair perception can be effectively reduced and the channel performance can be improved as well.
Author Keywords: Economic spillover;AI governance;Channel performance
Authors with affiliations: Guizhou University of Finance and Economics College of Business Administration, Guiyang, China; Guizhou University of Finance and Economics College of Business Administration, Guiyang, China

Title: Nanoservice Infrastructure Notation (NINo) and the ASPIRE Interns
Authors: C. T. Pascale; M. Rice; S. Sharma
Source title: 2020 IEEE Integrated STEM Education Conference (ISEC)
Abstract: NINo is a future DevOps / Data Science pipeline tool that is being developed by JHU APL and two ASPIRE interns. The goal of this capability is to expose function-level capabilities, via either a simple application or configuration file, for use in Docker [1], Serverless Architectures [2], or data science/analytic pipelines. The goal is similar to efforts such as Metaparticle [3] and Source-to-Image[4] that aim to lower the barrier to horizontal scaling of data processing and analysis capabilities. In previous years ASPIRE interns have developed tools to ease the acceptance of DevOps principles in JHU APL. They have created a web application, Harmonia, that asked users a few simple questions and supplied the scaffolding for a software project with artifacts to support sound software engineering processes. The lack of user interest has driven us to a more focused objective. NINo will focus on easing deployment to cloud environments. Ideally, any person could develop cloud-based data science services. The team and its work has been organized in an asynchronous and agile manner. There have been three members working on three subsystems: configuration, framework/integration, and artifact generation. An incremental and prototype-driven approach has allowed for creation of increasingly more functional software as internship has proceeded. Interns have been given extensive control over their development processes and have investigated the programming frameworks used. While the initial stages have not resulted in a complete system, the interns have improved their programming skills and complete common coding challenges. The team is close to integration testing and initial demonstration. As the academic year closes, team members will work on design improvement, refactoring, and generation of future feature requests from prospective users. One summer intern will focus on developing a user interface for configuring and observing results.
Authors with affiliations: NA; NA; NA

Title: A Frequency Reconfigurable Antenna Used for L Band
Authors: X. Wang; Y. Shang; F. Shang
Source title: 2020 IEEE 3rd International Conference on Electronic Information and Communication Technology (ICEICT)
Abstract: A inductive loading frequency reconfigurable microstrip antenna is investigated in this paper. The patch antenna is fed by an L-shaped probe, four parasitic patch which consists of long probe, inductive and horizontal branches is introduced on the 2nd layer. The frequency reconfigurable is realization by controlling the ON-OFF states of PIN diodes, which is connected to the branch. Consequently, a compact microstrip antenna with high selectivity is obtained. Simulation results show that the proposed antenna could be operate at 1.1GHz, 1.2GHz and 1.4GHz while keeping a compacted dimension. The simulation results of S11and radiation pattern shows that the proposed antenna can meet the needs of multi-scenario application in L band.
Author Keywords: frequency reconfigurable;inductive loading;microstrip antenna;simulation
Authors with affiliations: School of Electronic Engineering, Xian University of Post & Telecommunications, Xi'an, China; College of Electronic and Information Engineering, Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, Nanjing, China; School of Electronic Engineering, Xian University of Post & Telecommunications, Xi'an, China

Title: A Multibeam Antenna for Multi-Orbit LEO Satellites and Terminals with a Very Simple Tracking Technique
Authors: M. Sanad; N. Hassan
Source title: 2022 5th International Conference on Communications, Signal Processing, and their Applications (ICCSPA)
Abstract: A foldable/deployable multi-beam antenna has been developed for Low-Earth Orbit (LEO) satellites and ground stations. It consists of dual parabolic cylindrical reflectors with multiple resonant feeds. It can generate an arbitrary number of beams with arbitrary vertical and horizontal beam-tilt for each beam. It can be remotely controlled to cover any arbitrary area having any shape/size. It has a very wide frequency band-width. It can even, simultaneously, work at multi wide frequency bands such as 5G-sub-6GHz band (3.3-6.0 GHz), Ku-band (10–16 GHz) and Ka-band (18–31 GHz). A very simple beam tracking technique has been developed without using any adaptive methods. For any specific satellite orbit, the orientation of the ground station (terminal) antenna will always be adjusted such that its generated beams are parallel to the satellite's beams and directed toward them. This automatic orientation of the ground station (terminal) antenna, completely, depends on its location, orientation and elevation with no need for any adaptive beam steering/tracking or any adaptive beam-shaping. Furthermore, the terminal antenna can simultaneously communicate with multiple satellites in different orbits. For example, a penta beam terminal antenna can, simultaneously, communicate with five satellites in five different orbits.
Author Keywords: Multibeam LEO satellite antennas;LEO terminal antennas;simple LEO satellite beam steering and tracking;multiple LEO-orbit terminals;MIMO in LEO satellites and terminals
Authors with affiliations: Faculty of Engineering, Cairo University; Faculty of Engineering, Cairo University

Title: Multi-layer Integrated Flight Operation Quality Assurance Platform for Business Aircraft
Authors: C. Li; M. Zhong; J. Zhang
Source title: 2021 IEEE 3rd International Conference on Civil Aviation Safety and Information Technology (ICCASIT)
Abstract: An integrated business aircraft FOQA platform is developed in this work to monitor the routine flight operation and ensure flight safety. Based on the Microsoft. NET Framework by XML web service, the service-oriented architecture, and browser/server network architecture, the cross-system and cross-database network application platform is built and has the functions of data decoding, event detection, and statistical analysis of business aircraft types. The integration and unified management of business aircraft FOQA results and customized data services through an on- demand release model are thus realized, which can provide statistics according to agreed types and conduct horizontal statistical analysis of flight data of various business aircraft companies. The results show that the platform improves the timeliness and FOQA resource sharing of business aircraft and can better meet the existing FOQA needs. The platform can effectively control business aircraft operational risks, ensure flight safety, and promote the implementation of business aircraft FOQA in China.
Author Keywords: business aircraft;flight operation quality assurance;browser/server structure;business modular integration and sharing;QAR data analysis
Authors with affiliations: Aviation Safety Research Institute, China Academy of Civil Aviation Science and Technology, Beijing, China; Aviation Safety Research Institute, China Academy of Civil Aviation Science and Technology, Beijing, China; Beijing ZeroPlus Technology Co., Ltd, Beijing, China

Title: Calculation of Change of the Rotors Centering According to the Geodetic Data
Authors: G. A. Ustavich; V. G. Salnikov
Source title: 2019 International Multi-Conference on Industrial Engineering and Modern Technologies (FarEastCon)
Abstract: Russia has started wide-spread application of gasturbine power plants (GTPP) lately. The specific feature of this equipment is single shaft configuration, thus gas and steam turbine, as well as common generator, is located in one single shaft. The transition from the installation of the system “turboset-foundation-ground” (TFG) to its continuous exploitation leads to the change of relative position of its rotor supports (bearings) especially in the condition of permafrost soil. The change in relative position of bearings involves the change of rotor centers: opening of coupling halves and their relative displacement in circle. Irregular displacement of rotor bearings in vertical section leads to the horizontal change of rotor centres. The purpose of the paper is to carry out the rotor centering of turboset using geodetic data. In the process of start-up and adjustment operations it is required to adjust spatial position of the basic parts of the steam and gas-turbine set to project specified values. In order to do this it is strongly required to follow thoroughly the order of the geodetic measurement and to control the project-specified position of the major parts of the steam and gas-turbine set in such a way, that the mounting of its separate parts would be provided with the geodetic error not more than 0,08-0,10 MM. The paper provides the calculation of rotor centre change according to geodetic data. In order to obtain the rotor change values there were carried out the cycles of high-accuracy leveling based on the marks, located on the bearings, and 3D model of foundation plate and shaft line after the mounting of the turboset had been completed The given method of rotors' alignment was tested in the construction and exploitation of three power complexes PGU - 420 of the Nygan power plant, total capacity 1080 MW.
Author Keywords: turboset;tacheometer;the accuracy;the reflecting plate;the rotors centering
Authors with affiliations: Head of Department Engineering Surveying and Mining Geodesy, Siberian State University of Geosystems and Technologies, lNovosibirsk, Russia; Head of Department Engineering Surveying and Mining Geodesy, Siberian State University of Geosystems and Technologies, Novosibirsk, Russia

Title: Laser Beam Deflection of a 2D LiDAR for Canopy Detection on an Autonomous Spraying Robot
Authors: C. Cariou; J. -C. Roux; R. Lenain
Source title: 2021 7th International Conference on Automation, Robotics and Applications (ICARA)
Abstract: Spraying robots are particularly expected in viticulture and arboriculture to safely target and adapt the quantities of phytosanitary products on canopy. However, to maintain a financial profitability for the farmer wishing to adopt a robotized solution, the cost must be reduced. Therefore, instead of adding expensive and redundant sensors to measure the shape of the vegetation close to the robot, this paper investigates the possibility to deflect by a rotating mirror a part of the laser beams of the horizontal 2D LiDAR positionned in front of most of the current mobile robots for security and navigation purposes. This use of the 2D LiDAR aims to obtain at low cost the required 3D information on the canopy. Experimental results on a real spraying robot enable to highlight the interest of this approach: the presence and height of the canopy can be accurately measured, and the nozzles of the spraying boom can be controlled independantly and accordingly. To focus the measurements on a certain area, the angular variations of the mirror can be reduced or on the contrary increased to have a global overview of the environment. This original approach opens new opportunities with a 2D LiDAR for other configurations and field applications.
Author Keywords: Mobile robots;agriculture;canopy detection;Li-DAR;laser beams deflection;rotating mirror;pesticide spraying
Authors with affiliations: University Clermont Auvergne, INRAE UR TSCF, Aubiere, France; University Clermont Auvergne, INRAE UR TSCF, Aubiere, France; University Clermont Auvergne, INRAE UR TSCF, Aubiere, France

Title: Planar phased array based on stripline-fed antenna with a parallel feeding network
Authors: Q. D. Nguyen; T. Huong Ngo; D. T. Pham; H. Ha Bui; H. V. Tran
Source title: 2023 17th European Conference on Antennas and Propagation (EuCAP)
Abstract: The design of a planar phased array composing of 12 linear subarrays in the vertical plane has been investigated in this paper. Each linear in-phase subarray consists of 24 compact stripline-fed antennas in the horizontal plane. The proposed linear subarray is fed by a 24-port parallel feeding network where amplitudes at the output ports are controlled by a Taylor distribution with sidelobe level of -36 dB. The planar array has been fabricated and measured in the frequency band from 3.2 – 3.6 GHz. The simulation and measurement results show a good agreement and the planar phased array is adapted to the requirements for 3D radar application.
Author Keywords: Stripline-fed antenna;planar phased array;parallel feeding network;ultralow sidelobe level;3D radar
Authors with affiliations: Viettel High Technology Industries Corporation, Hanoi, Vietnam; Viettel High Technology Industries Corporation, Hanoi, Vietnam; Viettel High Technology Industries Corporation, Hanoi, Vietnam; Viettel High Technology Industries Corporation, Hanoi, Vietnam; Viettel High Technology Industries Corporation, Hanoi, Vietnam

Title: Effect of Transverse Openings on Structural Behavior of Reinforced Concrete curved Beams
Authors: S. F. Abdulameer; L. S. Rasheed
Source title: 2022 International Symposium on Multidisciplinary Studies and Innovative Technologies (ISMSIT)
Abstract: In this research, the effect of horizontal openings for two models of reinforced concrete was studied, and the original model was without openings, and a weakness was observed in the model with openings. We used an external reinforcement by means of carbon fibers, and an increase in the bearing capacity was observed. Compared to the control CCB, the ultimate load capacity of all specimens (CBH.O and CBH.S) reduced by about (11.7 percent and 5.4 percent, in both).
Author Keywords: curve beam;Transverse Openings;CFRP
Authors with affiliations: Civil Eng. Department, University of Kerbala, University of Kerbala, Kerbala, Iraq; Civil Eng. Department, University of Kerbala, University of Kerbala, Kerbala, Iraq

Title: Design of a multi-channel POlarimeter-INTerferometer system based on terahertz solid-state diode sources on EAST
Authors: C. Xu; Z. Y. Zou; J. B. Zhang; S. X. Wang; B. Hong; C. L. Lan; X. D. Pan; H. Q. Liu
Source title: 2022 47th International Conference on Infrared, Millimeter and Terahertz Waves (IRMMW-THz)
Abstract: Plasma position plays a critical role in fusion plasma performance, and any loss of the plasma position control is not acceptable for safe fusion device operations. To maintain a high temperature plasma, the plasma should not touch the wall of the vacuum chamber and be confined in the magnetic field. So studying fast and accurate plasma position measurement technique is very necessary. Traditional measurement methods are affected by discharge duration, high temperature and electromagnetic interference. The plasma position can also be measured by Faraday-effect polarimeter as a non-inductive position sensor with fast time response. In this work, a multi-channel Vertical POlarimeter-INTerferometer (V-POINT) based on 0.65 Thz solid-state diode sources (SSDS) for horizontal plasma position measurements on the EAST tokamak has been designed. The optical design and bench test results of the V-POINT on EAST will be presented.
Authors with affiliations: Lanzhou University, Lanzhou, China; Hefei Comprehensive National Science Center, Institute of Energy, Hefei, China; Chinese Academy of Science, Institute of Plasma Physics, Hefei, China; Chinese Academy of Science, Institute of Plasma Physics, Hefei, China; Lanzhou University, Lanzhou, China; Lanzhou University, Lanzhou, China; Lanzhou University, Lanzhou, China; Chinese Academy of Science, Institute of Plasma Physics, Hefei, China

Title: Circular Patch Frequency Tunable Antenna with Switching Polarization Feed Configuration
Authors: S. Kumar M; Y. Kumar Choukiker
Source title: 2019 International Conference on Vision Towards Emerging Trends in Communication and Networking (ViTECoN)
Abstract: Circular patch antenna for frequency reconfigurable and polarization switching in the antenna using feed configuration is presented. On varying capacitance of the varactor diode from 2.67pF to 0.99pF the antenna tuned from 1.85 to 2.55 GHz impedance bandwidth (32%). The cascaded branch line coupler (BLC) with switching feed configuration is used to achieve polarization reconfiguration (i.e.) vertical linear (VL)/horizontal linear (HL) polarization, RHCP, LHCP in the antenna. The proposed feed network is used to control tunable over a wideband from 1.5 to 3 GHz. The impedance bandwidth of patch antenna is matched with the impedance bandwidth of cascaded BLC feed network to achieve all the performance.
Author Keywords: Varactor diode;frequency reconfigurable;polarization reconfigurable;branch line coupler;SPDT;SP4T
Authors with affiliations: Department of Communication Engineering, School of Electronics Engineering Vellore Institute of Technology (VIT) University, Vellore, India; Department of Communication Engineering, School of Electronics Engineering Vellore Institute of Technology (VIT) University, Vellore, India

Title: An Adaptive Multiple Backtracking UKF Method Based on Krein Space Theory for Marine Vehicles Alignment Process
Authors: J. Wang; X. Chen; X. Shao
Source title: IEEE Transactions on Vehicular Technology
Abstract: The large misalignment errors of horizontal and azimuthal angle cannot be converged rapidly on the sea surface due to extra disturbance of linear and angular motions caused by wind and waves, which increases the time cost of marine vehicles alignment process and ultimately limits the SINS quick working capability. In order to solve the above problem, an adaptive multiple backtracking UKF method based on Krein space theory is proposed in this paper. Firstly, considering time-varying calibration errors of inertial sensors, a novel robust posterior filtering equation in Krein space is designed to improve the matching degree between the physical process and the mathematical model. Moreover, combined with the multiple forward and reverse navigation processes, an adaptive calculation times control method in backtracking UKF based on the innovation is constructed to solve the nonlinear fast alignment problem in the case of large misalignment angle errors with the purpose of further intelligently shortening the alignment time and ensuring alignment accuracy simultaneously in different periods and working environments. The physical experiment results demonstrate that the horizontal and azimuthal alignment accuracy of the proposed algorithm are improved compared with standard CKF alignment algorithm.
Author Keywords: Initial alignment;backtracking navigation;krein space;adaptive intelligently control;robust filter
Authors with affiliations: School of Instrument Science and Engineering, Southeast University, Nanjing, China; School of Instrument Science and Engineering, Southeast University, Nanjing, China; School of Instrument Science and Engineering, Southeast University, Nanjing, China

Title: Geopositioning Improvement of ZY-3 Satellite Imagery Integrating GF-7 Laser Altimetry Data
Authors: C. Liu; X. Tang; H. Zhang; G. Li; X. Wang; F. Li
Source title: IEEE Geoscience and Remote Sensing Letters
Abstract: Improving the accuracy of block adjustment with few or no ground control points (GCPs) is one of the core issues for satellite imagery high-precision mapping. The GaoFen-7 (GF-7) satellite laser altimeter system is the first Chinese formal spaceborne laser altimeter system, which is equipped with laser footprint cameras for the first time. Given the very high height accuracy and high planimetric accuracy of the instrument, this letter proposed an adjustment method of ZiYuan-3 (ZY-3) satellite imagery by integrating GF-7 laser altimetry data. The laser control points (LCPs) were automatically extracted according to the registration of the footprint images and stereo images. Furthermore, the combined adjustment was performed with the LCPs as the vertical control and horizontal constraint. The performance of the proposed method was evaluated by using 417 stereo scenes of ZY-3 images and 954 LCPs, covering an area of 158 000 km2 in Shandong, China. The results demonstrated that, only by using all LCPs as the vertical control, the root mean square error (RMSE) of elevation can be significantly improved from the original 8.82 to 1.40 m. Moreover, the planimetric RMSE decreased from the original 15.31 to 3.58 m with residual randomness when 45 LCPs were used as the horizontal constraint. Our method provides an alternative solution for satellite imagery geopositioning improvement without GCPs.
Author Keywords: Block adjustment;footprint image match;GF-7 laser altimetry data;ZY3 satellite
Authors with affiliations: Land Satellite Remote Sensing Application Center, Ministry of Natural Resources of China, Beijing, China; Land Satellite Remote Sensing Application Center, Ministry of Natural Resources of China, Beijing, China; Land Satellite Remote Sensing Application Center, Ministry of Natural Resources of China, Beijing, China; Land Satellite Remote Sensing Application Center, Ministry of Natural Resources of China, Beijing, China; Land Satellite Remote Sensing Application Center, Ministry of Natural Resources of China, Beijing, China; Shandong Provincial Institute of Land Surveying and Mapping, Jinan, China

Title: Temperature Stability Analysis of Thin-Film Lithium Niobate SH0 Plate Wave Resonators
Authors: M. -H. Li; C. -Y. Chen; R. Lu; Y. Yang; T. Wu; S. Gong
Source title: Journal of Microelectromechanical Systems
Abstract: This work presents an extensive study on the temperature coefficient of frequency (TCF) for thin-film lithium niobate (LiNbO3) resonators. To capture the temperature-frequency behavior for each vibration mode, a one-dimensional (1D) multi-section TCF model is proposed and verified by both the finite-element method (FEM) and experiments. By partitioning the metallized and non-metallized sections of the interdigitated transducers (IDT) as distinct TCF blocks and properly considering the spatial energy distribution, the TCF of each mode can be accurately predicted. Two higher lateral-order resonators based on the fundamental shear-horizontal mode (SH0) are designed and fabricated on a LiNbO3-on-SiO2 wafer to provide odd- and even-order harmonics. TCFs of the first 6 overtones (from 84 to 515 MHz) are calculated using the material properties given in the literature, exhibiting a maximum TCF difference of 3 ppm/K between the theoretical prediction and measurement results. Although only SH0 resonators are selected for experimental verification, the proposed multi-section TCF model can be applied to other plate wave MEMS resonators. [2019-0112].
Author Keywords: Microelectromechanical devices;piezoelectricity;resonators;frequency control;temperature coefficient of frequency;lithium niobate
Authors with affiliations: Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign, Urbana, USA; Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC), Hsinchu, Taiwan; Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign, Urbana, USA; Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign, Urbana, USA; School of Information Science and Technology, ShanghaiTech University, Shanghai, China; Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign, Urbana, USA

Title: Scalable Multi-Versioning Ordered Key-Value Stores with Persistent Memory Support
Authors: B. Nicolae
Source title: 2022 IEEE International Parallel and Distributed Processing Symposium (IPDPS)
Abstract: Ordered key-value stores (or sorted maps/dictionaries) are a fundamental building block in a large variety of both sequential and parallel/distributed algorithms. However, most state-of-art approaches are either based on ephemeral in-memory representations that are difficult to persist and/or not scalable enough under concurrent access (e.g., red-black trees, skip lists), and/or not lightweight enough (e.g. database engines). Furthermore, there is an increasing need to provide versioning support, which is needed in a variety of scenarios: introspection, provenance tracking, revisiting previous intermediate results. To address these challenges, we propose a new lightweight dictionary data structure that simultaneously provides support for multi-versioning, persistency and scalability under concurrent access. We demonstrate its effectiveness through a series of experiments, in which it outperforms several state-of-art approaches, both in terms of vertical and horizontal scalability.
Author Keywords: key-value store;ordered dictionary;versioning control;scalable access under concurrency;persistent memory
Authors with affiliations: Argonne National Laboratory, USA

Title: Production Process Balancing: A Two-Level Optimization Approach
Authors: D. Filatova; C. El-Nouty
Source title: 2019 International Conference on Information and Digital Technologies (IDT)
Abstract: We consider a production transformation problem in the context of the digitalization era. Taking into account ISA S95-1 level model ans standards of ISO 22400, we introduce the two-level optimization algorithm, which allows on the vertical and horizontal integration of various systems of the enterprise as well as on the profit maximization by means of the production line balancing. The case study on the drugs production process supported by "As-Is/To-Be" modeling technique in FlexSim simulation software illustrates the effectiveness of the proposed solution.
Author Keywords: computer aided modeling;cyber-physical system;FlexSim;optimal control;optimization
Authors with affiliations: WZiMK, Kielce University of Technology, Kielce, Polska; WZiMK, Kielce University of Technology, Kielce, Polska

Title: Exploration and Calculation of Very Fine Geodetic Model for DC Grounding Electrodes, Part I: Measurement and Computation
Authors: B. Wan; J. Liu; B. Tan; X. Zhang; L. Gao; Z. Pan
Source title: 2021 IEEE 4th International Electrical and Energy Conference (CIEEC)
Abstract: The design and operation of DC grounding electrodes and the assessment of their adverse effects on the surrounding environment bring considerable difficulties and uncertainties in their realization. The technical characteristics of five geologic exploration methods applied to fine geodetic electrical exploration are first compared, and the linear filtering considering depth of burial and the transmission line model has been proposed to solve the problem of high theoretical difficulty and complicated algorithm in solving the fine earth model of the horizontal layered DC grounding pole.
Author Keywords: DC grounding electrode;fine geodesic model;linear filtering;four-point method;controlled source audio-frequency magnetotelluric;static effects

Title: Neuromorphic System Using Memcapacitors and Autonomous Local Learning
Authors: M. Kimura; Y. Ishisaki; Y. Miyabe; H. Yoshida; I. Ogawa; T. Yokoyama; K. -I. Haga; E. Tokumitsu; Y. Nakashima
Source title: IEEE Transactions on Neural Networks and Learning Systems
Abstract: Artificial intelligence is used for various applications and is promising as an indispensable infrastructure in future societies. Neural networks are representative technologies that imitate human brains and exhibit various advantages. However, the size is bulky, the power is huge, and some advantages are not demonstrated because they are executed on Neumann-type computers. Neuromorphic systems are biomimetic systems from the hardware level to implement neuron and synapse elements, and the size is compact, the power is low, and the operation is robust. However, because the conventional ones are not composed of fully optimized hardware, the power is not yet minimal, and extra control circuits must be used. In this article, we developed a neuromorphic system using memcapacitors and autonomous local learning. By using memcapacitors, the power can be minimal, and by using autonomous local learning, the control circuits to handle the synapse elements can be deleted. First, the memcapacitors are completed in a cross-bar array, where the ferroelectric layers are sandwiched between the horizontal and perpendicular electrodes. The polarization and capacitance exhibit hysteresis due to the dielectric polarization. Next, autonomous local learning is introduced as follows. During the training phase, associative patterns to be memorized are directly sent, relatively high voltages are applied, and dielectric polarizations are induced. During the operation phase, relatively low voltages are applied, and input signals are weighted with the capacitances of the memcapacitors, summed, and transferred as the output signals. Finally, the experimental system is set up, and the experimental results are acquired. The memorized patterns during the training phase, distorted patterns as the input signals during the operation phase, and retrieved patterns as the output signals in the operation phase are shown. Researchers found that the retrieved patterns are completely the same as the memorized patterns. This means that the neuromorphic system works as an associative memory.
Author Keywords: Autonomous local learning;cross-bar array;ferroelectric layer;memcapacitor;neuromorphic system
Authors with affiliations: Graduate School of Science and Technology, Ryukoku University, Seta, Otsu, Japan; Graduate School of Science and Technology, Ryukoku University, Seta, Otsu, Japan; Graduate School of Science and Technology, Ryukoku University, Seta, Otsu, Japan; Graduate School of Science and Technology, Ryukoku University, Seta, Otsu, Japan; Graduate School of Science and Technology, Ryukoku University, Seta, Otsu, Japan; Graduate School of Science and Technology, Ryukoku University, Seta, Otsu, Japan; Graduate School of Advanced Science and Technology, Japan Advanced Institute of Science and Technology (JAIST), Asahidai, Nomi, Japan; Graduate School of Advanced Science and Technology, Japan Advanced Institute of Science and Technology (JAIST), Asahidai, Nomi, Japan; Graduate School of Science and Technology, Nara Institute of Science and Technology, Takayama, Ikoma, Japan

Title: Why fly blind? Event-based visual guidance for ornithopter robot flight
Authors: A. G. Eguíluz; J. P. Rodríguez-Gómez; R. Tapia; F. J. Maldonado; J. Á. Acosta; J. R. Martínez-de Dios; A. Ollero
Source title: 2021 IEEE/RSJ International Conference on Intelligent Robots and Systems (IROS)
Abstract: The development of perception and control methods that allow bird-scale flapping-wing robots (a.k.a. ornithopters) to perform autonomously is an under-researched area. This paper presents a fully onboard event-based method for ornithopter robot visual guidance. The method uses event cameras to exploit their fast response and robustness against motion blur in order to feed the ornithopter control loop at high rates (100 Hz). The proposed scheme visually guides the robot using line features extracted in the event image plane and controls the flight by actuating over the horizontal and vertical tail deflections. It has been validated on board a real ornithopter robot with real-time computation in low-cost hardware. The experimental evaluation includes sets of experiments with different maneuvers indoors and outdoors.
Author Keywords: ornithopter;flapping-wing;event camera;line features;tracking;visual servoing;computer vision

Title: Automatic Extraction of Seismic Data Horizon Across Faults
Authors: J. Li; W. Huang
Source title: IEEE Transactions on Geoscience and Remote Sensing
Abstract: Most of the traditional horizon interpretation methods are based on the dip of the seismic data. Since the dip does not correctly reflect the discontinuous reflection characteristics of the events, these methods usually cannot extract the horizons containing faults well. Meanwhile, the field seismic data observed in complex areas are generally with low signal-to-noise ratio (SNR), which makes the extraction of horizons difficult. To address these problems, an automatic horizon extraction approach under fault control is investigated in this article. First, the horizon dip is obtained by using plane wave destruction (PWD), and the dip information can be utilized to control the overall trend of the horizon curve. Based on the dip information, we can also calculate the weight coefficients to characterize the faults. The fault characterization results can better guide the horizon extraction. Then, the dynamic time warping (DTW) is used for phase matching to further obtain the similar slope and describe the details of the horizontal curve. Finally, the horizon extraction equation is developed with the dip and phase information as the guide and solved iteratively to obtain the final horizon curve. The effectiveness of the presented approach is tested by both synthetic and field data. The results demonstrate that the presented approach can accurately pick the horizon information across faults and is more stable in the condition of low SNR compared with previous methods.
Author Keywords: Automatic extraction;dynamic time warping (DTW);fault identification;local similarity;seismic horizon interpretation
Authors with affiliations: State Key Laboratory of Petroleum Resources and Prospecting, China University of Petroleum-Beijing, Beijing, China; State Key Laboratory of Petroleum Resources and Prospecting, China University of Petroleum-Beijing, Beijing, China

Title: Development Ideas and Overall Infrastructure of Energy Internet
Authors: Z. Yongjie
Source title: 2022 IEEE 6th Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration (EI2)
Abstract: The Energy Internet is a new ecological energy system with renewable energy as the priority, power energy as the basis, multi-energy coordination, supply and consumption coordination, centralized and distributed coordination, and wide participation of the public. It has attracted wide attention. In view of the development ideas and overall structure elements of Energy Internet, firstly, the research status and significance at home and abroad are investigated from the aspects of planning, design, control, evaluation and transaction of Energy Internet. Secondly, on the basis of explaining that the Energy Internet is a horizontal multi-source complementary, vertical source, network, load, storage and other links highly coordinated, energy and information highly integrated intelligent energy network, and the Energy Internet is divided into levels. Then, a general structure of Energy Internet based on the concept of hierarchical partition control is proposed, and the architecture of Energy Internet is expounded from application, software, hardware, data, deployment, etc. Finally, according to the new business and business form of Energy Internet development, the corresponding development ideas are put forward, and the key technologies that need to be laid out in the key technical directions of Energy Internet, such as planning, power generation, transmission, power transformation, distribution, power consumption and business model, are further elaborated.
Author Keywords: Energy Internet;integrated energy system;key technologies;development ideas;overall structure
Authors with affiliations: Nanjing SAC Power Grid Automation Co., Ltd., Nanjing, China

Title: Automatic Information Model Generation for Industrial Edge Applications Based on IEC 61499 and OPC UA
Authors: W. Dai; Y. Zhang; Y. Zhang; J. Kang; D. Huang
Source title: IEEE Transactions on Industrial Informatics
Abstract: The Industry 4.0 and Industrial Internet provides vertical and horizontal integration between edge devices and industrial cloud platforms. A flexible and interoperable information model is crucial for enabling device-level intelligence as well as cloud-edge collaboration. Deep integration between the control and information model is necessary for supporting closed-loop optimization between the cloud and edge devices. This article proposes an automatic information model generation method based on the IEC 61499 and OPC unified architecture standards. Model transformation rules between two models from design time to runtime are presented. A discrete manufacturing case study is used to prove that the proposed method can significantly reduce the development time for distributed information models. The integrated control and information models at runtime can provide strong support for dynamic reconfiguration to address changing requirements.
Author Keywords: Automatic model generation;IEC 61499;industrial edge computing;information modeling;OPC unified architecture (UA)
Authors with affiliations: Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China; Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China; Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China; Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China; Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China

Title: Analysis of the amount of flux variation on the HTS surface by the oscillation of HTS magnetic bearing rotor
Authors: R. Taniguchi; S. Ishida; K. Yagi; S. Ohashi
Source title: IEEE Transactions on Magnetics
Abstract: Magnetic bearing is used in flywheel energy storage system and can address energy loss at contact points in rotating because a rotor can be supported without contact points. However, in order to keep a rotor levitating, a control system is required. The HTS magnetic bearing levitates the rotor by pinning force without a control system and of a rotor including permanent magnets and a HTS. The vertical oscillation of the rotor is suppressed because the flux is interlinked to the outside of the HTS. Therefore, the rotor oscillates in the horizontal direction in rotating. This oscillation generates the flux variation on the HTS surface and it decreases the number of revolutions. This paper proposes an analysis of flux variation on the HTS surface by the oscillation of HTS magnetic bearing rotor. The effect of the oscillation of the rotor on the number of revolutions is shown by the analysis of the flux variation of the HTS. In the analysis results, the amount of flux variation increased rapidly because the rotor increases the oscillation. The flux variation causes a decrease the in number of revolutions and the small oscillations cause flux variation on the HTS surface. However, the decrease in the number of revolutions is small because the amount of the flux variation is small.
Author Keywords: Flywheel;High-temperature superconductor;Magnetic bearing;Permanent magnet;Pinning force
Authors with affiliations: Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Kansai University Suita, Osaka, Japan; Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Kansai University Suita, Osaka, Japan; Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Kansai University Suita, Osaka, Japan; Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Kansai University Suita, Osaka, Japan

Title: Development of block-based coding teaching tool with agriculture application (Smart farm)
Authors: N. Khaosang; N. Nirapai; K. Kongmanee; C. Chantharasenawong; J. Srirat
Source title: 2021 6th International STEM Education Conference (iSTEM-Ed)
Abstract: This study aims to build and install an irrigation system for a rectangular vegetable plot at Wat Rang Sanae Nakhon Chan school, Ratchaburi, Thailand. The motion of the water spray nozzle is similar to CNC machines with linear movements in two horizontal directions and it must be easily controlled by block-based coding suitable for Grade 5–6 students. The advantages of block-based controlled irrigation system are to promote teaching and learning in computational science at the elementary level for students to experience tangible programming results which should enhance learning outcome retention. The Smart Farm device performance assessment consists of nozzle head position accuracy, water content accuracy and usability of web interface with the m Block software, all of which have shown satisfactory results during the tests. A survey result taken by teachers and students during an on-site test shows high level of satisfaction in ease of use and practicality for education.
Author Keywords: Computer Science Education;Smart Farm
